note.para: This information is provided primarily for Shorewall developers. Users are expected to install from pre-built tarballs or packages.

section.title: Git Taxonomy
section.para: The Shorewall Git tree at Sourceforge serves as the master repository for Shorewall 4.4 and later versions. It is not possible to simply export a directory from SVN and run the install.sh script in that directory. A build step is required to produce a directory that is suitable for the install.sh script to run in.

section.title: trunk
section.para: The development branch of each product is kept here.

section.para: There are also several other directories which are described in the following sub-sections.

section.title: trunk/docs
section.para: The development release XML documents. Depending on the point in the release cycle, these documents may also apply to the current stable version. In that case, there is no docs directory in that release's directory in branches.

section.title: trunk/web
section.para: The files from the web site that are maintained in HTML format. are kept in this directory.

section.title: trunk/manpages, trunk/manpages6, trunk/manpages-lite and trunk/manpages6-lite
section.para: The development release XML manpages. Depending on the point in the release cycle, these documents may also apply to the current stable version. In that case, there will be no corresponding directories in the release's directory in branches.

section.title: Build Tools
section.para: As described above, the build tools are kept in trunk/tools/build. They are described in the following sections.

section.title: setversion
section.para: The setversion script updates the version number is a directory.
The version may either be a minor version or a patch version.
